thread.title: Apple shares close at all-time high, again
thread.title_full: Apple shares close at all-time high, again

author: Buster Hein
title: Apple shares close at all-time high, again
text:
AAPL is booming! Photo: Buster Hein/Cult of Mac 
One day after Apple stock set a new all-time high mark, the company’s shares have done it again, closing today with a new record. 
At the end of trading today AAPL was up 0.37% with a price of $137.7 per share, beating yesterday’s high of $136.68 . 
Apple stock has been a great investment the last few weeks. The company’s shares have experienced a steady rise since mid-November. Prices started booming after Apple posted its historic Q1 2017 earnings that saw record-breaking iPhone sales. 
Wall Street analysts have been raising their target prices on Apple over the last few weeks too. Morgan Stanley’s Katy Huberty issued a note to clients raising her target price for Apple from $150 to $154. Analysts at Goldman Sachs also set a target price of $150. 
Investors are also getting excited for the iPhone 8 that will launch this fall. The handset is Apple’s most anticipated device ever with rumors swirling that it could pack a ton of new features that will trigger an avalanche of upgrades when it comes out later this year.
